info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 4:06PM PDT until August 12 at 6:00PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL CLARK COUNTY... At 406 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain surrounding Searchlight in southern Clark County. The expected rainfall rate is 0.75 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Searchlight, Cottonwood Cove Campground, Cottonwood Cove, Cal-Nev-Ari, State Route 164 and State Route 165. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.75-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
